intro: Zanthoxylum chiloperone, commonly known as the Chilean prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to South America, particularly Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its spiny branches and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into red, fleshy berries, which are an important food source for various birds and mammals. Its bark and leaves contain compounds with medicinal properties, traditionally used by indigenous communities for their anti-inflammatory and analgesic effects.
